image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: A concept image of two workers in high-vis walking past a row of large batteries.

props.synopsis: A large battery project in South Australia sells for nearly $500 million as investment in renewable energy surges.

title.children: Millions invested in big batteries amid net zero transition

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Sydney's beloved Asian elephant pair is preparing for a new life with a herd on the plains of South Australia.

title.children: Taronga Zoo's elephants pack their trunks for new home in SA

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses running on the road

props.synopsis: A trip to the hospital and some badly mangled feet couldn't stop Amber Bryant as she ran from Adelaide to Broken Hill to raise funds and awareness for endometriosis.

title.children: Runner completes 500km in the dark for endometriosis awareness

image.altText: The landscape of White Cliffs from the air

props.synopsis: Before the remote town of White Cliffs got state-funded transport to Broken Hill 300 kilometres away, some locals went long stretches without essential services and supplies.

title.children: Outback bus service 'essential' to far-flung opal mining town

image.altText: Aliir Aliir of Port Adelaide catches a ball during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

props.synopsis: After the death of Pope Francis, Catholics around the world are reckoning with the future of the church. Australia's congregation has been shifting and changing with the times.

title.children: The percentage of Catholics in Australia is headed for an all-time low

image.altText: A grey feral cat looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Research tracking released bilbies and bettongs in remote SA has found feral cats are their biggest killer.

title.children: Feral cats killing more native animals than previously thought

image.altText: A man in a maroon collared shirt is pictured seating

props.synopsis: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

title.children: Boothby is a relatively wealthy electorate, but voters still worry about the cost of living

image.altText: Audience members in a red-lit room with screen at front saying Byron underground film festival.

props.synopsis: As streaming sees more and more people forgoing traditional cinemas to watch content at home, micro-cinemas showing alternative and niche films are rising in popularity across the country.

title.children: Micro-cinema subculture emerges as traditional audience streams at home

image.altText: A large black and white cruise ship with a tug on the water.

props.synopsis: A luxury cruise ship will stop in Wallaroo in 2027, carrying almost 500 passengers, renewing the town's hope of benefiting from the cruise industry.

title.children: Cruise ships to return to SA's Copper Coast after seven-year hiatus

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up a Medicare card as he speaks animatedly.

props.synopsis: Time and time again, the Coalition has been forced to deny claims about plans to privatise Australia's healthcare system.

title.children: PM has been brandishing a Medicare card and Dutton is reaping what he sowed

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and ties looking slightly disgruntled.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers and Angus Taylor spar over economic and business policies in Melbourne. Australian shares rally after Wall Street regained ground on hopes of a trade war de-escalation. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Treasurer and shadow treasurer face-off in business debate

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Treasurer goes on the attack on costings
Will taxes be cut for businesses?
What's the most important thing to do as growth slows?

image.altText: A wooden casket with men dressed in red standing around

props.synopsis: World leaders are expected to attend the Pope's funeral, which the Vatican has confirmed will take place on Saturday.

title.children: Pope's funeral date confirmed with Prince William and Trump to attend

image.altText: two male politicians wearing suits

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has pledged to better prepare Australia for future geo-strategic threats by spending an additional $21 billion between now and 2030, which would be almost double Labor's planned increase to the defence budget.

title.children: 'Missing in action' Hastie returns as Coalition dials up defence spending

image.altText: A man rests with his hands on the floor of a gym, with dumbbells near him and a woman walking past.

props.synopsis: Online "masculinity" content is mainstream and wide-ranging — far broader than the toxic Andrew Tate style manosphere or incel culture touched on in the hit Netflix series Adolescence.

title.children: New data on masculinity influencers a 'wake-up call' to all Australians

image.altText: A person places a vote in a Senate ballot box for Canberra.

props.synopsis: More than 500,000 votes were cast in the first day of early voting on Tuesday, as the trend continues of more Australians heading to the ballot box before the official polling day.

title.children: Early voters smash first day record

image.altText: A black and white photo of Australian cricketer Keith Stackpole.

props.synopsis: Former Australia Test opener Keith Stackpole dies, aged 84, after a dynamic career including seven centuries and a brilliant Ashes double ton.

title.children: Keith Stackpole remembered as 'a fantastic cricketer and a great bloke'

image.altText: An aerial shot of a coastal suburb.

props.synopsis: Housing affordability weighs heavily on voters in a NSW Central Coast seat that has been won by the party that goes on to form government at every election since 1983.

title.children: For more than 40 years, whoever wins this seat wins the election

image.altText: Paul Gaughan wears green paramedic uniform. Standing on boardwalk, phone in his hand, beach in background.

props.synopsis: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

title.children: Farmers and paramedics demand improvements to patchy mobile signals

image.altText: Woman on computer, generic

props.synopsis: The federal government has doubled down on its decision to give YouTube a carve-out from the teen social media ban, despite privately assuring rival platforms that "no final decisions" have been made, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Emails reveal government's mixed messaging on YouTube's 'sweetheart deal'

image.altText: An old man wearing glasses and a dark blue suit with a white shirt and tie

props.synopsis: A former high-flying movie producer with a string of Oscar winners, Harvey Weinstein returns to court for a retrial of his rape and sexual assault charges.

title.children: Majority-female jury seated in Harvey Weinstein retrial

image.altText: Lori Vallow Daybell wears her hair out with a concerned look on her face.

props.synopsis: This is the Idaho murderer's fourth life sentence after she was already convicted in Idaho in the killings of her two youngest children and a romantic rival.

title.children: 'Doomsday mum' convicted of conspiring to kill estranged husband

image.altText: Doctor giving vaccine to a senior man in a medical clinic.

props.synopsis: Less than half of Australia's aged care residents aged 75 years and older are up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, despite being at highest risk of severe health outcomes.

title.children: Planning to get a flu shot? Older people recommended to get a COVID booster too

image.altText: An aerial view of cars packed into a suburban development.

props.synopsis: McEwen is part new suburbs, part rural towns and part established suburbs, and it is a seat the Liberal Party will be working to take from Labor in the coming election.

title.children: Choked roads a major issue for voters in Melbourne's north

image.altText: An atomic bomb blast

props.synopsis: The tiny Pacific island of Tinian was once used to cause the most devastating blast in human history. Now its 80-year-old airfield is being brought back to life, and locals fear history could repeat itself.

title.children: Forgotten WWII airfield with dark legacy set for revival

image.altText: A crashed car on a stretch of highway. Ared car nearby and a fire truck.

props.synopsis: No bail application for a Sunshine Coast man facing 15 charges over a fatal crash, shooting and string of alleged carjackings on Monday.

title.children: Driver accused of fatal Sunshine Coast carjackings to stay behind bars

props.synopsis: The third leaders debate saw both Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese pulled up for using "talking points" in a clash which came after hundreds of thousands of Australians had already cast their ballots.

title.children: Leaders vow to hold line on nuclear after the election in third debate

image.altText: Three photos of a woman holding and cooking with cottage cheese

props.synopsis: Supermarkets struggle to meet demand for cottage cheese as the product becomes the subject of viral videos.

title.children: Cottage cheese in short supply as TikTok trend drives popularity

image.altText: Shipping containers in multiple colours sit in a yard with freight trains parked behind them on a bright sunny day

props.synopsis: The International Monetary Fund says the US will be hardest hit by its own increased tariffs, which the organisation says is the biggest upheaval to global trade in 80 years.

title.children: IMF downgrades Australia's growth, with tariffs to hit US hardest

image.altText: festival at night

props.synopsis: Music lovers who wanted to be a part of history by attending the supposed final edition of the Bluesfest in Byron Bay are angry to hear the festival will return next year.

title.children: Punters at final Bluesfest feel 'betrayed' as festival renewed for 2026

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: The US had been pushing for an extension to the Easter ceasefire declared between the two sides, which expired on Sunday night, local time.

title.children: Zelenskyy says Ukraine to negotiate with Russia if ceasefire put in place

image.altText: An artists image of a white-water facility.

props.synopsis: Opponents of a whitewater centre planned for south-east Queensland say they've "drawn the short straw" on Olympic venues.

title.children: 'It's got no water': Councillors and locals question Olympic canoe venue
